B. Konsep Asuhan Keperawatan
1. Pengkajian Keperawatan (Dermawan, 2012;36)
a. Riwayat kesehatan sekarang
Biasanya pada pasien yang sering mengeluh nyeripada tulang, merasakan mual,
muntah, tidak nafsu makan dan lemas
b. Riwayat penyakit dahulu
Biasanyamengalami demam yangnaikturun, gusi berdarah, lemas dandibawa ke
fasilitas kesehatan terdekat karenabelum mengetahuitentang penyakit yang
diderita.
19
c. Riwayat penyakit keluarga
Adakah keluarga yang pernah mengalamipenyakit LLA karena merupakan
penyakitgenetik (keturunan)
d. Riwayat pada faktor-faktor pencetus
Seperti pada dosisbesar, radiasi dan obat-obatan tertentu secara kronis.
e. Manifestasi dari hasil pemeriksaan
Biasanyaditandai dnegan pembesaran sum-sum tulang dengan sel-sel leukemia
yang selanjutnya menekan fungsi sum-sum tulang, sehingga menyebabkan gejala
seperti dibawah ini
- Anemia
Ditandai dengan penurunanberat badan,kelelahan, pucat, malaise, kelemahan dan
anoreksia.
- Trombositopenia
Ditandai dengan perdarahan gusi, mudah memar, dan petekie
- Netropenia
Ditandai dengan demam tanpa adanya infeksi,berkeringat di malam hari
(Nursalam dkk, 2010;100)
f. Pemeriksaan fisik
Didapati adanya pembesaran dari kelenjar getah bening (limfadenopati),
pembesaran limpa(splenomegali), dan pembesaran hati(hepato megali). Pada
pasien dengan LLA precusor sel-T dapatditemukan adanya dispnea dan
pembesaran vena kavakarena adanya supresi darikelenjar getahbening di
mediastinum yang mengalamipembesaran sekitar 5% kasus akan melibatkan
sistem saraf pusat dan dapat ditemukan adanya peningkatan tekanan
intrakranial(sakit kepala, muntah; papil edema) atau paralisis saraf kranialis

B. Nursing Care Concept
Nursing Assessment (Dermawan, 2012;36)
a. Current Health History
Typically found in patients who frequently complain of bone pain, experience nausea,
vomiting, lack of appetite, and weakness.
b. Past Medical History
Usually includes a history of fluctuating fever, bleeding gums, weakness, and having been taken to
the nearest healthcare facility because they were unaware of the disease
they were suffering from.
19
c. Family Medical History
Is there any family member who has experienced LLA, as it is
a genetic (hereditary) disease
d. History of Triggering Factors
Such as high doses, radiation, and certain medications taken chronically.
e. Manifestations from Examination Results
Typically indicated by the enlargement of the bone marrow with leukemia cells,
which subsequently suppresses bone marrow function, leading to symptoms
such as
- Anemia
Indicated by weight loss, fatigue, pallor, malaise, weakness, and
anorexia.
- Thrombocytopenia
Indicated by bleeding gums, easy bruising, and petechiae.
- Neutropenia
Indicated by fever without signs of infection, night sweats.
(Nursalam et al., 2010;100)
f. Physical Examination
There is enlargement of lymph nodes (lymphadenopathy),
enlargement of the spleen (splenomegaly), and enlargement of the liver (hepatomegaly). In
patients with precursor T-cell leukemia, symptoms may include dyspnea and
enlargement of the superior vena cava due to suppression of lymph nodes in
the mediastinum. Approximately 5% of cases may involve
the central nervous system, which can lead to increased pressure of
intracranial (headache, vomiting; papilledema) or cranial nerve paralysis.
